title: Is a millionaire still considered wealthy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure. More wealthy than someone with 100,000 dollars, less wealthy than someone with a billion. It’s the kind of personal wealth that about half of Americans can approach, sometime in their life. Typically, when I did retirement plans, even teachers and firemen were retiring with close to a million dollars, if they were thrifty. The secret is starting your savings early, and putting off dipping into it until retirement, then only taking out 5% or so per year and getting close to that in return after inflation. It’s not hard to do, and I’ve put away 10% of my salary for years, as well as having a good retirement pension. That, and your home equity, will push you over the threshold.

Being a millionaire doesn’t make you rich. A millionaire is an individual whose net worth or wealth is equal to or exceeds one million units of currency.
